abstract: Ensure a positive user experience when presenting a view controller as a sheet.
overview:
## Overview

By default, a user can use a pull-down gesture to dismiss a view controller that presents as a sheet. UIKit allows you to disable the pull-down gesture in situations where using it might cause the user to lose data or recent changes. It’s also possible to explain why the user is unable to dismiss the view controller presentation by presenting an instance of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIAlertController].

### Disable the ability to dismiss a presentation

To disable dismissal of a view controller presentation, set [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewController/isModalInPresentation] to `true`.

It’s also possible to return `false` from the presentation delegate’s [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIAdaptivePresentationControllerDelegate/presentationControllerShouldDismiss(_:)] method. However, the system doesn’t call this method if [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewController/isModalInPresentation] is `true` or when dismissing the presentation programmatically.
